intro: Epidendrum rhynchophorum, commonly known as the red-tipped epidendrum, is a member of the Orchidaceae family and is native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and produces striking, showy flowers with a distinctive red-tipped lip. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid tropical environments. Epidendrum rhynchophorum is valued in horticulture for its ornamental flowers and relatively easy care requirements.
